sen.j: なら燈花会（ならとうかえ）は、1999年から毎年8月上旬（10日間）に、奈良市（奈良公園一帯）で開催される燈花と呼ばれるろうそくを使用した行事。
sen.e: Nara Tokae is the annual event that has been held in Nara (mostly in and around Nara Park) in the early August (for ten days) since 1999 using the candles called toka (lantern).
Nara Tokae is the annual event that has been held in Nara (mostly in and around Nara Park) in the early August (for ten days) since 1999 using the candles called toka (lantern).
Nara Tokae is the annual event that has been held in Nara (mostly in and around Nara Park) in the early August (for ten days) since 1999 using the candles called toka (lantern).

sen.j: 燈花とは、灯心の先に形成される花の形をしたろうの塊のことでである。
sen.e: Toka is the flower-shaped lump of candle formed on the tip of lamp wick.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Toka is the flower-shaped lump of candle formed on the tip of lamp wick.
Toka is the flower-shaped lump of candle formed on the tip of lamp wick.

sen.j: 仏教においてこれを縁起の良いものとすることに由来して「燈花会」と命名されている。
sen.e: The event is named 'Tokae' because in Buddhism the lump is considered something auspicious.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The event is named 'Tokae' because in Buddhism the lump is considered something auspicious.
The event is named 'Tokae' because in Buddhism the lump is considered something auspicious.

sen.j: 期間中は世界遺産に囲まれた奈良公園一面にろうそくを並べる。
sen.e: During the festival, candles are lit on all over the ground of Nara Park surrounded by World Heritage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the festival, candles are lit on all over the ground of Nara Park surrounded by World Heritage.
During the festival, candles are lit on all over the ground of Nara Park surrounded by World Heritage.

sen.j: 幻想的かつ神秘的な雰囲気が演出され、奈良における夏の風物詩として定着した。
sen.e: In the event fantastic and mysterious atmosphere is produced, and the festival has settled as one of the summer features in Nara.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the event fantastic and mysterious atmosphere is produced, and the festival has become established as one of the summer features in Nara.
In the event fantastic and mysterious atmosphere is produced, and the festival has become established as one of the summer features in Nara.

sen.j: 当初のろうそく使用本数は一日当たり約1万本だった。
sen.e: At the beginning about ten thousand candles per day were used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the beginning about ten thousand candles per day were used.
At the beginning about ten thousand candles per day were used.

sen.j: だが、年々増加し、2007年には約2万本を使用。
sen.e: But the number increased every year, and in 2007 about twenty thousand candles were used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But the number increased every year, and in 2007 about twenty thousand candles were used.
But the number increased every year, and in 2007 about twenty thousand candles were used.

sen.j: 開催エリアは下記である。
sen.e: The festival is held in venues described as below.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The festival is held in venues described as below.
The festival is held in venues described as below.

sen.j: 奈良市内の各自治会や商店街がこの期間独自で燈花会を開催することがある。
sen.e: Sometimes the residents' communities and shopping arcades hold their own Tokae during this period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sometimes the residents' communities and shopping arcades hold their own Tokae during this period.
Sometimes the residents' communities and shopping arcades hold their own Tokae during this period.

sen.j: 2007年は計20カ所に及ぶこととなった。
sen.e: The number of the festival venues was as large as twenty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The number of the festival venues was as large as twenty in 2007.
The number of the festival venues was as large as twenty in 2007.

sen.j: 1999年の第1回目以降来場者は年々増えている。
sen.e: The number of the visitors has been increasing every year since the first festival in 1999.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The number of the visitors has been increasing every year since the first festival in 1999.
The number of the visitors has been increasing every year since the first festival in 1999.

sen.j: 近年は毎回約70万人の来客を数える、夏の大イベントに成長している。
sen.e: Recently the festival has grown to a big annual event in summer that more than 700 thousand tourists visit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Recently the festival has grown to a big annual event in summer that more than 700 thousand tourists visit.
Recently the festival has grown to a big annual event in summer that more than 700 thousand tourists visit.

sen.j: 当初のろうそくは、通常のパラフィンを使用した一般的に市販されている材質の物によるフローティングキャンドルであった。
sen.e: At first the floating candles made from commercially available normal paraffin were used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At first the floating candles made from commercially available normal paraffin were used.
At first the floating candles made from commercially available normal paraffin were used.

sen.j: だが、2003年頃に、自然環境に優しいパーム油脂を使用し、万が一鹿が口にしても安全な天然由来素材を使用した物に変更した。
sen.e: In around 2003, however, the candles were changed into the ones made with natural material and eco-friendly palm oil so that deer may not be poisoned if they should eat them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In around 2003, however, the candles were changed into the ones made with natural material and eco-friendly palm oil so that deer may not be poisoned if they should eat them.
In around 2003, however, the candles were changed into the ones made with natural material and eco-friendly palm oil so that deer may not be poisoned if they should eat them.

sen.j: この天然由来のろうそくは煤がほとんど出ないため、結果的にろうそくを受けるカップの清掃作業回数も削減された。
sen.e: The candles made from natural materials emit little soot, so, as a result, the number of cleaning up the cups that hold candles has decreased.
The candles made from natural materials emit little soot, so, as a result, the number of cleaning up the cups that hold candles has decreased.
The candles made from natural materials emit little soot, so, as a result, the number of cleaning up the cups that hold candles has decreased.

sen.j: また、ろうそくの形状も燈花会のロゴをモチーフにした物となった。
sen.e: And the shape of the candle has been changed to the one in the motif of Tokae's logo.
And the shape of the candle has been changed to the one in the motif of Tokae's logo.
And the shape of the candle has been changed to the one in the motif of Tokae's logo.

sen.j: 2005年からは、カラーカップも使用し、色に因るデザイン化も図っている。
sen.e: Since 2005 colored cups started to be used, making the festival more colorful.
Since 2005 colored cups started to be used, making the festival more colorful.
Since 2005 colored cups started to be used, making the festival more colorful.

sen.j: カップも当初使用の物は順次交換している。
sen.e: The cups used at first were gradually replaced with new ones.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The cups used at first were gradually replaced with new ones.
The cups used at first were gradually replaced with new ones.

sen.j: 現在使用している大半の物は不燃材料を使用した「燃えないカップ」になり、更なる安全対策を施した。
sen.e: The most of the cups currently used are 'non-burnable cups' with which incombustible materials are used, and by doing so further safety measures have been taken.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The most of the cups currently used are 'non-burnable cups' with which incombustible materials are used, and by doing so further safety measures have been taken.
The most of the cups currently used are 'non-burnable cups' with which incombustible materials are used, and by doing so further safety measures have been taken.

sen.j: （当初から不燃性カップです。）
sen.e: (From the beginning incombustible cups have been used.)
(From the beginning incombustible cups have been used.)
(From the beginning incombustible cups have been used.)

sen.j: NPO法人「なら燈花会の会」が主体となって運営されている。
sen.e: The festival is managed by incorporated nonprofit organization 'Nara Tokae no kai (association of Nara Tokae Festival), which is an operating body of the festival.
The festival is managed by incorporated nonprofit organization 'Nara Tokae no kai (association of Nara Tokae Festival), which is an operating body of the festival.
The festival is managed by incorporated nonprofit organization 'Nara Tokae no kai (association of Nara Tokae Festival), which is an operating body of the festival.

sen.j: 全員がボランティアで構成されており、会員は約150人程度である。
sen.e: All of the members are volunteers, and the number of the membership is about 150.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: All of the members are volunteers, and the number of the membership is about 150.
All of the members are volunteers, and the number of the membership is about 150.

sen.j: 当日の火付け点灯・後かたづけなどを行う当日の「登録サポーター」は一日当たり200人から300人前後である。
sen.e: The number of 'registered volunteers' that do the work of lightening the candles and cleanup for the days during the festival is about from 200 to 300 a day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The number of 'registered volunteers' that do the work of lightening the candles and cleanup for the days during the festival is about from 200 to 300 a day.
The number of 'registered volunteers' that do the work of lightening the candles and cleanup for the days during the festival is about from 200 to 300 a day.

sen.j: このため、合計一日当たり400人、延べ4000人程度のボランティアで運営している。
sen.e: So the festival is managed by 400 per day and in total 4000 volunteers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: So the festival is managed by 400 per day and in total 4000 volunteers.
So the festival is managed by 400 per day and in total 4000 volunteers.

sen.j: 年々、ボランティアの数も増加の傾向にある。
sen.e: The number of volunteers tend to increase year by year.
The number of volunteers tends to increase year by year.
The number of volunteers tends to increase year by year.

Ukigumo-enchi Park site

sen.e: Kasugano-enchi Park site

Kagami-ike Pond of Todaiji Temple site (only August 13 and 14)

sen.e: Ukimi-do Hall site

sen.e: the site in front of Nara National Museum
the site in front of Nara National Museum
the site in front of Nara National Museum

sen.j: 興福寺・猿沢池と五十二段会場
sen.e: Sarusawa-ike in Kofuku-ji Temple and Gojunidan (52 steps) site
Sarusawa-ike in Kofuku-ji Temple and Gojunidan (52 steps) site
Sarusawa-ike in Kofuku-ji Temple and Gojunidan (52 steps) site

sen.j: 春日大社参道会場（14日のみ）
sen.e: Sando (an approach to the temple or shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine site
Sando (an approach to the temple or shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine site
Sando (an approach to the temple or shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine site

sen.j: 早咲きの日 - 開催日前日に行う高齢者や障害者限定のプレイベント。
sen.e: Hayazaki no hi (precocious day), the pre-event the day before the festival for the elderly and disabled.
Hayazaki no hi (precocious day), the pre-event the day before the festival for the elderly and disabled.
Hayazaki no hi (precocious day), the pre-event the day before the festival for the elderly and disabled.

sen.j: 火入れ式
sen.e: Hihire shiki (lightening ceremony)
Hihire shiki (lightening ceremony)
Hihire shiki (lightening ceremony)

sen.j: 一客一燈 - 客が自分でろうそくに火を燈し、並べることができる（500円）。
sen.e: Ikkyaku Itto, the visitors can light their own candles and put them on the festival site (500 yen).
Ikkyaku Itto, the visitors can light their own candles and put them on the festival site (500 yen).
Ikkyaku Itto, the visitors can light their own candles and put them on the festival site (500 yen).

sen.j: ほのあかりライブ - 様々な楽器演奏者や声楽者を招きろうそくの明かりに囲まれて行うライブ。
sen.e: Honoakari Live (concert), the live concert in which invited various instrument players and vocalists perform concert surrounded by the light of the candles.
Honoakari Live (concert), the live concert in which invited various instrument players and vocalists perform concert surrounded by the light of the candles.
Honoakari Live (concert), the live concert in which invited various instrument players and vocalists perform concert surrounded by the light of the candles.

sen.j: なら燈花会能 - 奈良県新公会堂能楽ホールで開催。
sen.e: Nara Tokae Noh (Noh performance at Nara Tokae Festival) performed at Noh Theatre in Nara Prefectural New Public Hall.
Nara Tokae Noh (Noh performance at Nara Tokae Festival) performed at Noh Theatre in Nara Prefectural New Public Hall.
Nara Tokae Noh (Noh performance at Nara Tokae Festival) performed at Noh Theatre in Nara Prefectural New Public Hall.

tit.e: The events held in neighboring areas during the period of the festival
The events held in neighboring areas during the period of the festival

sen.j: ライトアッププロムナード・なら 7月1日（火）～10月31日（金
sen.e: Illumination street Nara, from Tuesday, July 1 through Friday, October 31.
Illumination street Nara, from Tuesday, July 1 through Friday, October 31.

sen.j: 春日大社中元万燈籠 8月14日（木）・15日（金）
sen.e: Kasugataisha Chugen Mantoro (Lantern festival at Kasuga-taisha Shrine), Thursday, August 14 and Friday, 15.
Kasugataisha Chugen Mantoro (Lantern festival at Kasuga-taisha Shrine), Thursday, August 14 and Friday, 15.

sen.j: 東大寺万燈供養会 8月15日（金）
sen.e: Todaiji Manto Kuyo-e (event of offering votive lights to Buddha at Todai-ji Temple), Friday, August 15
Todaiji Manto Kuyo-e (event of offering votive lights to Buddha at Todai-ji Temple), Friday, August 15
Todaiji Manto Kuyo-e (event of offering votive lights to Buddha at Todai-ji Temple), Friday, August 15

sen.j: 奈良大文字送り火 8月15日（金） 2000点火
sen.e: Nara Daimonji Okuribi (bonfire at Nara)
Nara Daimonji Okuribi (bonfire at Nara) in which 2,000 bonfires are lighted on Friday, August 15.
Nara Daimonji Okuribi (bonfire at Nara) in which 2,000 bonfires are lighted on Friday, August 15.

sen.j: 元興寺 地蔵会万燈供養 8月23日（土）・24日（日）
sen.e: Jizo-e Manto Kuyo-e (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children, and offering many votive lights) at Gango-ji Temple, Saturday, August 23 and Sunday 24.
Jizo-e Manto Kuyo-e (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children, and offering many votive lights) at Gango-ji Temple, Saturday, August 23 and Sunday 24.

sen.j: 環境省 かおり風景100選
sen.e: The Most Tasteful 100 Landscapes, Ministry of Environment
The Most Tasteful 100 Landscapes, Ministry of Environment
The Most Tasteful 100 Landscapes, Ministry of Environment

sen.j: 国土交通省 全国地域づくり団体 国土交通大臣賞受賞
sen.e: Award of organization of building national communities by Minister of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism
Award of organization of building national communities by Minister of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism

sen.j: （財）地域活性化センター 第7回ふるさとイベント大賞 産業・環境部門賞受賞
sen.e: Award in the field of the industry and environment in the 7th Furusato Award by Japan Center for Regional Development
Award in the field of the industry and environment in the 7th Furusato Award by Japan Center for Regional Development
Award in the field of the industry and environment in the 7th Furusato Award by Japan Center for Regional Development

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道近鉄奈良駅より東へ徒歩5～15分。
sen.e: Five to fifteen minutes' walk from Kintetsu Nara Station of Kinki Nippon Railway Company
Five to fifteen minutes' walk from Kintetsu Nara Station of Kinki Nippon Railway Company
Five to fifteen minutes' walk from Kintetsu Nara Station of Kinki Nippon Railway Company

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道奈良駅より三条通りを東へ徒歩15～30分。
sen.e: Fifteen to thirty minutes' walk along Sanjo-dori Street toward east from JR West Nara Station
Fifteen to thirty minutes' walk along Sanjo-dori Street toward east from JR West Nara Station
Fifteen to thirty minutes' walk along Sanjo-dori Street toward east from JR West Nara Station

sen.j: 奈良交通市内循環バス外回り「氷室神社・国立博物館」･「大仏殿春日大社前」下車。
sen.e: Get off the bus at 'Himuro-jinja National Museum' or 'Daibutsuden Kasuga-taisha mae' of the outer loop of the Nara Kotsu City Loop Bus.
